PARAGRAPH.STRING: (IPA: IPA: 'kolkat̪a Bengali: কলকাতা) (formerly Calcutta) is the capital of the Indian state of West Bengal.
is located in eastern India on the east bank of the River Hooghly.
has a population of almost 5 million, with an extended metropolitan population of over 14 million, making
the third-largest urban agglomeration and the fourth-largest city in India.
served as the capital in India during the British Raj until 1911. Once the centre of modern education, science, culture and politics in India,
witnessed economic stagnation in the years following India's independence in 1947. Since 2000 however, an economic rejuvenation has arrested the morbid decline, leading to a spurt in
continues to struggle with urbanisation problems like poverty, pollution and traffic congestion. A vibrant city with a distinct socio-political culture,
revolutionary history, ranging from the Indian struggle for independence to the leftist and trade union movements.
Referred to as the "Cultural Capital of India", "The City of Processions", and the "City of Joy",
has been home to luminaries such as Rabindranath Tagore, Ronald Ross, Subhas Chandra Bose, Mother Teresa, Satyajit Ray, Satyendranath Bose, Jagdish Chandra Bose, Swami Vivekananda and many others.
